channel.itunes:summary: Bible teachings from Reality LA, a church in Hollywood, CA.

image.title: Reality LA Audio Podcast: Bible Teaching

channel.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles
channel.description: Bible teachings from Reality LA, a church in Hollywood, CA.

item.title: Church Planting in a Pagan City
item.itunes:title: Church Planting in a Pagan City
item.description: Whether the ancient Roman city of Philippi or the modern U.S. city of Los Angeles, the gospel transforms individuals, brings them together as a church, and impacts entire cities. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 16:11-40.
item.content:encoded: Whether the ancient Roman city of Philippi or the modern U.S. city of Los Angeles, the gospel transforms individuals, brings them together as a church, and impacts entire cities. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 16:11-40.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Everyday Mission
item.itunes:title: Everyday Mission
item.description: Mission is not just heroic moments -- Jesus advances his mission through ordinary faithfulness in everyday life. Pastor Jeremy Treat resumes our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 15:36 - 16:10.
item.content:encoded: Mission is not just heroic moments -- Jesus advances his mission through ordinary faithfulness in everyday life. Pastor Jeremy Treat resumes our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 15:36 - 16:10.

item.title: Serve in Some Capacity
item.itunes:title: Serve in Some Capacity
item.description: What are you already doing that God is inviting you to re-approach with a posture of sacrificial service? Where might God be calling you to go into new, costly service of his kingdom, people, and city? Pastor Kevin Weiner concludes our Essentials series with a sermon from James 2:14-17.
item.content:encoded: What are you already doing that God is inviting you to re-approach with a posture of sacrificial service? Where might God be calling you to go into new, costly service of his kingdom, people, and city? Pastor Kevin Weiner concludes our Essentials series with a sermon from James 2:14-17.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Be Involved in Christian Community
item.itunes:title: Be Involved in Christian Community
item.description: Only a community centered on Jesus can actually last because it's built on forgiveness before effort, grace before growth, and identity before obedience. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Essentials series with a sermon from Colossians 3:12-17 on the practices and postures of real community.
item.content:encoded: Only a community centered on Jesus can actually last because it's built on forgiveness before effort, grace before growth, and identity before obedience. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Essentials series with a sermon from Colossians 3:12-17 on the practices and postures of real community.

item.title: Engage in the Discipleship Pathway
item.itunes:title: Engage in the Discipleship Pathway
item.description: To be a disciple means to be a learner, or a student. Our discipleship pathway is important for us as a church because it gives us a common understanding of discipleship, a shared experience around following Jesus, and a common language to understand what it means to follow Jesus. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our Essentials series with a sermon from John 10:22-30.
item.content:encoded: To be a disciple means to be a learner, or a student. Our discipleship pathway is important for us as a church because it gives us a common understanding of discipleship, a shared experience around following Jesus, and a common language to understand what it means to follow Jesus. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our Essentials series with a sermon from John 10:22-30.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Gather on Sundays
item.itunes:title: Gather on Sundays
item.description: Sunday gatherings are sacred, communal, embodied, participatory, consistent, formational, missional....and essential! Pastor Jeremy launches our 4-week "Essentials" series with a sermon from Hebrews 10:19-25.
item.content:encoded: Sunday gatherings are sacred, communal, embodied, participatory, consistent, formational, missional....and essential! Pastor Jeremy launches our 4-week "Essentials" series with a sermon from Hebrews 10:19-25.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Vision Sunday 2026
item.itunes:title: Vision Sunday 2026
item.description: Who are we as a church, where have we been, where are we going, and what's your part? Pastor Jeremy Treat shares where we sense God leading us in 2026 and preaches a sermon from Jonah 3:1-5.
item.content:encoded: Who are we as a church, where have we been, where are we going, and what's your part? Pastor Jeremy Treat shares where we sense God leading us in 2026 and preaches a sermon from Jonah 3:1-5.

item.title: No Burden, Few Requirements
item.itunes:title: No Burden, Few Requirements
item.description: Christ followers from every nation are not defined by prescribed rituals and customs, but by faith in Christ. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 15:1-35.
item.content:encoded: Christ followers from every nation are not defined by prescribed rituals and customs, but by faith in Christ. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 15:1-35.

item.title: A Mission Worth Living For
item.itunes:title: A Mission Worth Living For
item.description: Living on mission with Jesus requires investing in the church, receiving from the church, and courage. Which means...it requires Christ! Pastor Nathan Potter resumes our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 14.
item.content:encoded: Living on mission with Jesus requires investing in the church, receiving from the church, and courage. Which means...it requires Christ! Pastor Nathan Potter resumes our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 14.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: God's Relentless Desire To Dwell With His People
item.itunes:title: God's Relentless Desire To Dwell With His People
item.description: Jesus is Immanuel, the one who came to be with us and to save us—this pure grace is truly the greatest gift of all. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a Christmas sermon from Matthew 1:18-25.
item.content:encoded: Jesus is Immanuel, the one who came to be with us and to save us—this pure grace is truly the greatest gift of all. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a Christmas sermon from Matthew 1:18-25.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Advent of Joy: God with Us
item.itunes:title: The Advent of Joy: God with Us
item.description: In a world full of darkness and despair, Advent is an annual reminder that we have real reasons for hope, that true peace is possible, that there is a full and lasting joy, and that true love exists because we have a God who's on mission to dwell with his people. Pastor Philip Chew continues our Advent series with a sermon from Ezekiel 37:15-28.
item.content:encoded: In a world full of darkness and despair, Advent is an annual reminder that we have real reasons for hope, that true peace is possible, that there is a full and lasting joy, and that true love exists because we have a God who's on mission to dwell with his people. Pastor Philip Chew continues our Advent series with a sermon from Ezekiel 37:15-28.

item.title: The Advent of Peace: Guarding Against Fear
item.itunes:title: The Advent of Peace: Guarding Against Fear
item.description: Jesus, the Prince of Peace, has purchased our entry into the presence of the living God by his own blood so we will have everlasting peace -- even in times of trouble. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Advent series with a sermon from 2 Kings 19:10-20.
item.content:encoded: Jesus, the Prince of Peace, has purchased our entry into the presence of the living God by his own blood so we will have everlasting peace -- even in times of trouble. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Advent series with a sermon from 2 Kings 19:10-20.

item.title: The Advent of Hope: Reversing the Curse
item.itunes:title: The Advent of Hope: Reversing the Curse
item.description: What is broken will be made beautiful, what is fractured will be made whole, what can only be dimly seen now will become a clear and present reality, death itself will be erased forever, sin will be no more, and Satan will be banished once and for all! This is the hope of Advent! Pastor Goodwin Deng launches our 2025 Advent series with a sermon from Genesis 3:1-19.
item.content:encoded: What is broken will be made beautiful, what is fractured will be made whole, what can only be dimly seen now will become a clear and present reality, death itself will be erased forever, sin will be no more, and Satan will be banished once and for all! This is the hope of Advent! Pastor Goodwin Deng launches our 2025 Advent series with a sermon from Genesis 3:1-19.

item.title: The Story of God's Promises
item.itunes:title: The Story of God's Promises
item.description: Don't give up on God for not keeping promises he never made. Cling instead to his actual promises. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 13:13-52.
item.content:encoded: Don't give up on God for not keeping promises he never made. Cling instead to his actual promises. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 13:13-52.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Global Gospel Encounters Opposition
item.itunes:title: The Global Gospel Encounters Opposition
item.description:
The cross of Jesus Christ is where justice and mercy meet -- the only place
where confrontation and freedom can coexist. Pastor Kevin Weiner continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 13:1-12.
item.content:encoded: The cross of Jesus Christ is where justice and mercy meet -- the only place where confrontation and freedom can coexist. Pastor Kevin Weiner continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 13:1-12.

item.title: Political Idolatry
item.itunes:title: Political Idolatry
item.description: Idolatry is making a good thing an ultimate thing, and political idolatry is looking to a politician, party, or nation in place of God. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 12:20-25.
item.content:encoded: Idolatry is making a good thing an ultimate thing, and political idolatry is looking to a politician, party, or nation in place of God. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 12:20-25.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Praying to the God Who Rescues
item.itunes:title: Praying to the God Who Rescues
item.description: Peter's story isn't just a miracle, it's a mirror of the gospel. And it's our story as well! The same power that raised Jesus from the grave is now breaking chains and setting his people free. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues hour series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 12:1-19.
item.content:encoded: Peter's story isn't just a miracle, it's a mirror of the gospel. And it's our story as well! The same power that raised Jesus from the grave is now breaking chains and setting his people free. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues hour series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 12:1-19.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Multicultural Church in Antioch
item.itunes:title: The Multicultural Church in Antioch
item.description: Acts paints an expansive vision of a multicultural, disciple-making church centered on Jesus and, in the city of Antioch, provides a specific example what that vision looks like on the ground: ordinary people, shaped by the gospel, becoming a community that reflects heaven on earth. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 11:1-30.
item.content:encoded: Acts paints an expansive vision of a multicultural, disciple-making church centered on Jesus and, in the city of Antioch, provides a specific example what that vision looks like on the ground: ordinary people, shaped by the gospel, becoming a community that reflects heaven on earth. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 11:1-30.

item.title: Good News for All
item.itunes:title: Good News for All
item.description: The gospel is good news for all because whoever comes to Jesus in repentance finds grace and forgiveness. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our series through Acts with sermon from the longest narrative in the entire book: Acts 10:1-48.
item.content:encoded: The gospel is good news for all because whoever comes to Jesus in repentance finds grace and forgiveness. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our series through Acts with sermon from the longest narrative in the entire book: Acts 10:1-48.

item.title: The Resurrection Continues
item.itunes:title: The Resurrection Continues
item.description: The resurrection of Jesus isn't just something we look back on or something we look forward to seeing after death. It continues today -- Jesus is still healing the broken, still bringing life where there was despair. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 9:32-43.
item.content:encoded: The resurrection of Jesus isn't just something we look back on or something we look forward to seeing after death. It continues today -- Jesus is still healing the broken, still bringing life where there was despair. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 9:32-43.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Not Who I Was
item.itunes:title: Not Who I Was
item.description: The story of Paul's radical conversion from a killer of Christians to the apostle who wrote over half the New Testament isn't just ancient history -- God is still in the business of turning enemies into family, and his work in our lives becomes a key way we can tell others about him. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 9:1-31.
item.content:encoded: The story of Paul's radical conversion from a killer of Christians to the apostle who wrote over half the New Testament isn't just ancient history -- God is still in the business of turning enemies into family, and his work in our lives becomes a key way we can tell others about him. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 9:1-31.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: A Spiritual Journey
item.itunes:title: A Spiritual Journey
item.description: We're all on a spiritual journey, longing for truth, meaning, purpose. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 8:26-40.
item.content:encoded: We're all on a spiritual journey, longing for truth, meaning, purpose. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 8:26-40.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Life in the Spirit
item.itunes:title: Life in the Spirit
item.description: Walking in the Spirit is always about drawing nearer to Jesus and making his name greater than our own. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Acts with sermon from Acts 8:14-25.
item.content:encoded: Walking in the Spirit is always about drawing nearer to Jesus and making his name greater than our own. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Acts with sermon from Acts 8:14-25.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Scattered for Mission
item.itunes:title: Scattered for Mission
item.description: God turns adversity into opportunity for mission, overcoming every authority and bringing radical change through the unrivaled power of the gospel. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 8:1-13.
item.content:encoded: God turns adversity into opportunity for mission, overcoming every authority and bringing radical change through the unrivaled power of the gospel. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 8:1-13.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Telling the Old Story
item.itunes:title: Telling the Old Story
item.description: The Old Testament is not a collection of moral stories about what we should do. It's one grand story about what God has done and will do for us. A story that culminates in Jesus. Pastor Jeremy Treat resumes our sermon series through the book of Acts with a sermon from Acts 6-7.
item.content:encoded: The Old Testament is not a collection of moral stories about what we should do. It's one grand story about what God has done and will do for us. A story that culminates in Jesus. Pastor Jeremy Treat resumes our sermon series through the book of Acts with a sermon from Acts 6-7.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Seeing Prophetically in a Cynical Age
item.itunes:title: Seeing Prophetically in a Cynical Age
item.description: We can see a truer reality in God than we're feeling in our lives. Guest pastor Devin Deuell continues our summer series with a sermon from Psalm 145.
item.content:encoded: We can see a truer reality in God than we're feeling in our lives. Guest pastor Devin Deuell continues our summer series with a sermon from Psalm 145.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Cure for Functional Atheism
item.itunes:title: The Cure for Functional Atheism
item.description: Atheism says there's no God, but functional atheism is behaving as if there's no God right here right now. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our summer series with a sermon from Psalm 14.
item.content:encoded: Atheism says there's no God, but functional atheism is behaving as if there's no God right here right now. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our summer series with a sermon from Psalm 14.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: For Flourishing, Not (Just) Funerals
item.itunes:title: For Flourishing, Not (Just) Funerals
item.description: Psalm 23 is the most-recited biblical passage at funerals, but it's not about death, it's about the truest life we can live! Guest preacher Ed Stetzer continues our summer series through the Psalms.
item.content:encoded: Psalm 23 is the most-recited biblical passage at funerals, but it's not about death, it's about the truest life we can live! Guest preacher Ed Stetzer continues our summer series through the Psalms.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angels

item.title: Overcoming Envy
item.itunes:title: Overcoming Envy
item.description: Envy is the great thief of happiness, but God gives us a perfect happiness in himself. Guest preacher Gavin Ortlund continues our summer teaching series with a sermon from Psalm 73.
item.content:encoded: Envy is the great thief of happiness, but God gives us a perfect happiness in himself. Guest preacher Gavin Ortlund continues our summer teaching series with a sermon from Psalm 73.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Hope in the Fog: Finding God When He Feels Far Away
item.itunes:title: Hope in the Fog: Finding God When He Feels Far Away
item.description: Where is God when we feel lost, rejected, or alone? When we're in pain or facing difficulties? Guest preacher Ryan Kwon launches our annual summer series through the Psalms with a sermon from Psalm 42.
item.content:encoded: Where is God when we feel lost, rejected, or alone? When we're in pain or facing difficulties? Guest preacher Ryan Kwon launches our annual summer series through the Psalms with a sermon from Psalm 42.

item.title: A Kingdom of Priests
item.itunes:title: A Kingdom of Priests
item.description: Mission isn't just something we do; it's who we are. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Exodus 19:4-6.
item.content:encoded: Mission isn't just something we do; it's who we are. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Exodus 19:4-6.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Leading the Movement
item.itunes:title: Leading the Movement
item.description: Gospel movements need godly leadership to sustain mission. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 6:1-7.
item.content:encoded: Gospel movements need godly leadership to sustain mission. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 6:1-7.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Resilient Church
item.itunes:title: The Resilient Church
item.description: How did a small group of social and religious outcasts withstand Roman persecution, go on to convert most of that same Roman Empire, then become the most diverse movement in history and largest religion in the world? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 5:12-42.
item.content:encoded: How did a small group of social and religious outcasts withstand Roman persecution, go on to convert most of that same Roman Empire, then become the most diverse movement in history and largest religion in the world? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 5:12-42.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: United and On Mission
item.itunes:title: United and On Mission
item.description: The church that's united is a church that's on mission -- and this matters to God. Pastor Philip Chew continues our series through the book of Acts with a sermon from Acts 4:31-5:11.
item.content:encoded: The church that's united is a church that's on mission -- and this matters to God. Pastor Philip Chew continues our series through the book of Acts with a sermon from Acts 4:31-5:11.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: How to Pray Like the Early Church
item.itunes:title: How to Pray Like the Early Church
item.description: The gospel enables us to stand before God, have relationship with God, and talk to God with confidence! Reality LA founding pastor Tim Chaddick continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 4:23-31.
item.content:encoded: The gospel enables us to stand before God, have relationship with God, and talk to God with confidence! Reality LA founding pastor Tim Chaddick continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 4:23-31.

item.title: Boldness in the Face of Opposition
item.itunes:title: Boldness in the Face of Opposition
item.description: Opposition is an opportunity to clarify the message and strengthen the movement -- but it requires Spirit-filled boldness. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 4:1-22.
item.content:encoded: Opposition is an opportunity to clarify the message and strengthen the movement -- but it requires Spirit-filled boldness. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 4:1-22.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Source of Holistic Healing
item.itunes:title: The Source of Holistic Healing
item.description: Holistic healing -- physical, emotional, relational, and spiritual -- is available today because of the suffering and exaltation of Jesus. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 3:1-26.
item.content:encoded: Holistic healing -- physical, emotional, relational, and spiritual -- is available today because of the suffering and exaltation of Jesus. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 3:1-26.

item.title: The Church at Its Best
item.itunes:title: The Church at Its Best
item.description: We might not always live up to our ideal, but that doesn't change who we are—the blood-bought people of God, saved by grace through faith, united to Christ by the power of the Spirit, and made possible through the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 2:42-47.
item.content:encoded: We might not always live up to our ideal, but that doesn't change who we are—the blood-bought people of God, saved by grace through faith, united to Christ by the power of the Spirit, and made possible through the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 2:42-47.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: God's Sovereign Plan
item.itunes:title: God's Sovereign Plan
item.description: The gospel is not God's "plan B," but was God's plan before the foundation of the world to reveal his glory and save his people. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 2:22-41.
item.content:encoded: The gospel is not God's "plan B," but was God's plan before the foundation of the world to reveal his glory and save his people. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 2:22-41.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Spirit-filled Church
item.itunes:title: The Spirit-filled Church
item.description: The church is a Spirit-filled, multicultural community witnessing to Jesus as the true king of the world. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 2:1-24.
item.content:encoded: The church is a Spirit-filled, multicultural community witnessing to Jesus as the true king of the world. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts 2:1-24.

item.title: A Threshold Moment
item.itunes:title: A Threshold Moment
item.description: When the disciples obeyed Jesus and stayed in Jerusalem to await the promised Holy Spirit, it was the transitional moment between the first and second chapters of the early church. Pastor Goodwin Deng continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts:1:12-26.
item.content:encoded: When the disciples obeyed Jesus and stayed in Jerusalem to await the promised Holy Spirit, it was the transitional moment between the first and second chapters of the early church. Pastor Goodwin Deng continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts:1:12-26.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Ascended King
item.itunes:title: The Ascended King
item.description: Our king's ascended. Our king's returning. What does this mean about how we live now, between the two? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts:1:9-11.
item.content:encoded: Our king's ascended. Our king's returning. What does this mean about how we live now, between the two? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Acts with a sermon from Acts:1:9-11.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: An Unstoppable Mission
item.itunes:title: An Unstoppable Mission
item.description: Jesus advances his mission through the local church by the power of the Spirit. Pastor Jeremy Treat launches our year-long series through the book of Acts with a sermon from Acts 1:1-8.
item.content:encoded: Jesus advances his mission through the local church by the power of the Spirit. Pastor Jeremy Treat launches our year-long series through the book of Acts with a sermon from Acts 1:1-8.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: I See the Lord
item.itunes:title: I See the Lord
item.description: We cannot fulfill our purpose on this earth without seeing and hearing from the one who made us. Pastor Nathan Potter preaches a sermon from Isaiah 6:1-8.
item.content:encoded: We cannot fulfill our purpose on this earth without seeing and hearing from the one who made us. Pastor Nathan Potter preaches a sermon from Isaiah 6:1-8.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Moment the Movement Began (Easter 2025)
item.itunes:title: The Moment the Movement Began (Easter 2025)
item.description: The resurrection of Jesus wasn't just an event, it was the beginning of a movement that can change our lives and transform our city. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches an Easter Sermon from John 20:19-21.
item.content:encoded: The resurrection of Jesus wasn't just an event, it was the beginning of a movement that can change our lives and transform our city. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches an Easter Sermon from John 20:19-21.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: By His Grace, For His Glory
item.itunes:title: By His Grace, For His Glory
item.description: Worship, praise, thanksgiving, and celebration cultivate joy deep within us—God is glorified when we are satisfied in him. Pastor Jeremy Treat concludes our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 6:15-16; 12:27-43.
item.content:encoded: Worship, praise, thanksgiving, and celebration cultivate joy deep within us—God is glorified when we are satisfied in him. Pastor Jeremy Treat concludes our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 6:15-16; 12:27-43.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Advancing Amid Opposition
item.itunes:title: Advancing Amid Opposition
item.description: Opposition will come when doing the Lord's work, whether in the form of distraction, criticism, or temptation. Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 6:1-14 on how to be resilient and faithful to the end in the midst of opposition.
item.content:encoded: Opposition will come when doing the Lord's work, whether in the form of distraction, criticism, or temptation. Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 6:1-14 on how to be resilient and faithful to the end in the midst of opposition.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Preach the Word, Care for the Poor
item.itunes:title: Preach the Word, Care for the Poor
item.description: Preaching God's Word is what moves us into caring for the poor as a reflection of God's heart. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 5:1-13; 8:1-8.
item.content:encoded: Preaching God's Word is what moves us into caring for the poor as a reflection of God's heart. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 5:1-13; 8:1-8.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Rebuilding with Generosity
item.itunes:title: Rebuilding with Generosity
item.description: Your weakness is a platform to show God's strength and your past struggles have prepared you to care for people going through the same. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 3:1-9; 7:70-72 on service and generosity.
item.content:encoded: Your weakness is a platform to show God's strength and your past struggles have prepared you to care for people going through the same. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 3:1-9; 7:70-72 on service and generosity.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: A Vision for the City
item.itunes:title: A Vision for the City
item.description: Where most people see a city in ruins, a person with vision sees the opportunity for renewal. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 2.
item.content:encoded: Where most people see a city in ruins, a person with vision sees the opportunity for renewal. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Rebuilding for Renewal series with a sermon from Nehemiah 2.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Weeping and Praying for the City
item.itunes:title: Weeping and Praying for the City
item.description: God specializes in rebuilding what's falling apart and renewing what's broken. Pastor Jeremy Treat begins our sermon series through Nehemiah with a sermon from Nehemiah 1.
item.content:encoded: God specializes in rebuilding what's falling apart and renewing what's broken. Pastor Jeremy Treat begins our sermon series through Nehemiah with a sermon from Nehemiah 1.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Sacred Space, Redeemed People
item.itunes:title: Sacred Space, Redeemed People
item.description: We are blessed to be a blessing. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Genesis 12:1-3 on God's vision for the connection between sacred space and his redeemed people.
item.content:encoded: We are blessed to be a blessing. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Genesis 12:1-3 on God's vision for the connection between sacred space and his redeemed people.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Praying Shamelessly
item.itunes:title: Praying Shamelessly
item.description:
At its best, desperation offers us an invitation to draw near to Jesus. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald preaches a sermon from Luke 11:1-13 about desperate prayer.

This is one of our focus areas for 2025. To hear our full vision for 2025, go to reality.la/vision2025.
item.content:encoded:
At its best, desperation offers us an invitation to draw near to Jesus. Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald preaches a sermon from Luke 11:1-13 about desperate prayer.

This is one of our focus areas for 2025. To hear our full vision for 2025, go to reality.la/vision2025.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Make Disciples
item.itunes:title: Make Disciples
item.description: What does it mean to be a disciple who makes disciples? Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Matthew 28:18-20.
item.content:encoded: What does it mean to be a disciple who makes disciples? Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Matthew 28:18-20.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: We Can Give All Because He's Given All
item.itunes:title: We Can Give All Because He's Given All
item.description:
The world says, "You don't have enough—hold on tight." The gospel says, "Jesus is enough—pour yourself out." Pastor Kevin Weiner preaches a sermon from 1 Kings 17:8-16 about sacrificial service.

This is one of our focus areas for 2025. To hear our full vision for 2025, go to reality.la/vision2025.
item.content:encoded:
The world says, "You don't have enough—hold on tight." The gospel says, "Jesus is enough—pour yourself out." Pastor Kevin Weiner preaches a sermon from 1 Kings 17:8-16 about sacrificial service.

This is one of our focus areas for 2025. To hear our full vision for 2025, go to reality.la/vision2025.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Vision Sunday 2025
item.itunes:title: Vision Sunday 2025
item.description: Who are we as a church, where have we been, where are we going, and what's your part? Pastor Jeremy Treat shares where we sense God leading us in 2025 and preaches a sermon from Acts 1:1-8.
item.content:encoded: Who are we as a church, where have we been, where are we going, and what's your part? Pastor Jeremy Treat shares where we sense God leading us in 2025 and preaches a sermon from Acts 1:1-8.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: God's Heart for the City
item.itunes:title: God's Heart for the City
item.description: We are in Los Angeles, for Los Angeles. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Jonah 4:11 about our city, our place in it, and God's love for it.
item.content:encoded: We are in Los Angeles, for Los Angeles. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Jonah 4:11 about our city, our place in it, and God's love for it.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: God Amid the Fires
item.itunes:title: God Amid the Fires
item.description: God is here with us, he is our refuge, he is ruling and redeeming in Los Angeles. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Psalm 46 and shares how our 2025 plans are adapting in light of the LA fires.
item.content:encoded: God is here with us, he is our refuge, he is ruling and redeeming in Los Angeles. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Psalm 46 and shares how our 2025 plans are adapting in light of the LA fires.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Grief as a Pathway to Hope
item.itunes:title: Grief as a Pathway to Hope
item.description: The Bible has an entire book devoted to grief and lament. Lamentations gives language to our souls and shows us that we can both mourn and hope as we look to God in the midst of crisis. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Lamentations 3:17-26.
item.content:encoded: The Bible has an entire book devoted to grief and lament. Lamentations gives language to our souls and shows us that we can both mourn and hope as we look to God in the midst of crisis. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Lamentations 3:17-26.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Melchizedek, Generosity, and Jesus
item.itunes:title: Melchizedek, Generosity, and Jesus
item.description: The story of Melchizedek gives us a foundation for generosity and a deeper vision of Jesus. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches the first sermon of 2025 from Genesis 14:17-24.
item.content:encoded: The story of Melchizedek gives us a foundation for generosity and a deeper vision of Jesus. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches the first sermon of 2025 from Genesis 14:17-24.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Two Paths
item.itunes:title: The Two Paths
item.description: Biblical wisdom is knowledge applied to life through faith. Pastor Kevin Weiner preaches a sermon from Proverbs 4:10-27.
item.content:encoded: Biblical wisdom is knowledge applied to life through faith. Pastor Kevin Weiner preaches a sermon from Proverbs 4:10-27.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Good News of Great Joy
item.itunes:title: Good News of Great Joy
item.description: The eternal son of God became a man and entered into the brokenness of this world. He joined us in our mess as a humble king who wields a vert different kind of power. Pastor Jeremy Treat concludes the Advent season with a Christmas sermon from Luke 2:1-21.
item.content:encoded: The eternal son of God became a man and entered into the brokenness of this world. He joined us in our mess as a humble king who wields a vert different kind of power. Pastor Jeremy Treat concludes the Advent season with a Christmas sermon from Luke 2:1-21.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: From Silence to Singing
item.itunes:title: From Silence to Singing
item.description: Do not lose hope because you have to wait. Pastor Adam Smith returns from Reality Carpinteria to preach an Advent sermon from Luke 1:57-80.
item.content:encoded: Do not lose hope because you have to wait. Pastor Adam Smith returns from Reality Carpinteria to preach an Advent sermon from Luke 1:57-80.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Magnificat, Mary's Christmas Hymn
item.itunes:title: The Magnificat, Mary's Christmas Hymn
item.description: To see what Jesus' first advent would mean to the world, seeing it from Mary's perspective is a good starting point—it's such good news that she shares that perspective in the form of a Hebrew song. Guest preacher Bobby Scott preaches an Advent sermon from Luke 1:39-56.
item.content:encoded: To see what Jesus' first advent would mean to the world, seeing it from Mary's perspective is a good starting point—it's such good news that she shares that perspective in the form of a Hebrew song. Guest preacher Bobby Scott preaches an Advent sermon from Luke 1:39-56.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: The Most High Becomes the Most Low
item.itunes:title: The Most High Becomes the Most Low
item.description: Advent is an opportunity to join with our sisters and brothers all over the world to reflect and to remember the hopelessness of our fallen condition without Jesus, but also to revel and rejoice in the joy of God's redemptive solution in Jesus. A week after the conclusion of our Good News for All series through the book of Luke, Pastor Goodwin Deng revisits Luke 1:26-38 for our first Advent sermon of 2024.
item.content:encoded: Advent is an opportunity to join with our sisters and brothers all over the world to reflect and to remember the hopelessness of our fallen condition without Jesus, but also to revel and rejoice in the joy of God's redemptive solution in Jesus. A week after the conclusion of our Good News for All series through the book of Luke, Pastor Goodwin Deng revisits Luke 1:26-38 for our first Advent sermon of 2024.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: The Ascension
item.itunes:title: The Ascension
item.description: Our hope is in not just in the crucified, resurrected Christ, but the ascended Christ who sits, reigns, gives, intercedes, and returns! Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Luke 24:48-53.
item.content:encoded: Our hope is in not just in the crucified, resurrected Christ, but the ascended Christ who sits, reigns, gives, intercedes, and returns! Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Luke 24:48-53.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: He Is Risen
item.itunes:title: He Is Risen
item.description: If Christ is truly raised from the dead, it means hope is possible, there's purpose in our suffering, we're not alone, his power can be made perfect in weakness, injustice has an expiration date, evil will be held accountable, and fear can be driven out by love! Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Luke 24:1-49.
item.content:encoded: If Christ is truly raised from the dead, it means hope is possible, there's purpose in our suffering, we're not alone, his power can be made perfect in weakness, injustice has an expiration date, evil will be held accountable, and fear can be driven out by love! Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches a sermon from Luke 24:1-49.

item.title: The Unexpected King
item.itunes:title: The Unexpected King
item.description: This week we reach the climax of the book of Luke! Pastor Philip Chew preaches a sermon from Luke 22:7-20 and Luke 23:26-49.
item.content:encoded: This week we reach the climax of the book of Luke! Pastor Philip Chew preaches a sermon from Luke 22:7-20 and Luke 23:26-49.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: A Matter Of Allegiance
item.itunes:title: A Matter Of Allegiance
item.description: Pastor Jeremy Treat explores what it means to give our ultimate allegiance to Christ over any political party. Through Jesus' response to a political question in Luke 20:19-26, he invites us to seek God's kingdom above all else, embracing faith over politics, unity over division, and Jesus over any party.
item.content:encoded: Pastor Jeremy Treat explores what it means to give our ultimate allegiance to Christ over any political party. Through Jesus' response to a political question in Luke 20:19-26, he invites us to seek God's kingdom above all else, embracing faith over politics, unity over division, and Jesus over any party.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: The Missing Piece
item.itunes:title: The Missing Piece
item.description: What does the parable of the wicked tenants teach us about the reality of sin and the character of God? Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 20:9-18.
item.content:encoded: What does the parable of the wicked tenants teach us about the reality of sin and the character of God? Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 20:9-18.

item.title: Lift Up Your Soul
item.itunes:title: Lift Up Your Soul
item.description: In a society focused on external appearance, emotional wellness, physical fitness, and relational wholeness, we tend to overlook a thriving soul. Pastor Jeremy Treat pauses our Good News for All series to share a teaching from Psalm 143.
item.content:encoded: In a society focused on external appearance, emotional wellness, physical fitness, and relational wholeness, we tend to overlook a thriving soul. Pastor Jeremy Treat pauses our Good News for All series to share a teaching from Psalm 143.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: Stewardship in God's Kingdom
item.itunes:title: Stewardship in God's Kingdom
item.description: Stewardship is about more than our money or possessions. It's about investing our entire lives in the kingdom of God. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 19:11-27.
item.content:encoded: Stewardship is about more than our money or possessions. It's about investing our entire lives in the kingdom of God. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 19:11-27.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: Zacchaeus Encounters Jesus
item.itunes:title: Zacchaeus Encounters Jesus
item.description: An encounter with Jesus really does change everything. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 19:1-10 about just such an encounter.
item.content:encoded: An encounter with Jesus really does change everything. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 19:1-10 about just such an encounter.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: How do I Inherit Eternal Life?
item.itunes:title: How do I Inherit Eternal Life?
item.description:
How can we ensure what we do matters? That our lives goes beyond the living of them?
In other words—how do we inherit eternal life? Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Good News for all series with a sermon from Luke 18:18-30.
item.content:encoded: How can we ensure what we do matters? That our lives goes beyond the living of them? In other words—how do we inherit eternal life? Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Good News for all series with a sermon from Luke 18:18-30.

item.title: Persistent Prayer
item.itunes:title: Persistent Prayer
item.description: Persisting in prayer is key to persevering in prayer. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 18:1-8.
item.content:encoded: Persisting in prayer is key to persevering in prayer. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 18:1-8.
item.itunes:author: Reality LA

item.title: The Prodigal Sons
item.itunes:title: The Prodigal Sons
item.description: God is moving. Today. Toward you. With compassion. Pastor Jeremy continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 15:11-32 on the parable of the prodigal sons.
item.content:encoded: God is moving. Today. Toward you. With compassion. Pastor Jeremy continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 15:11-32 on the parable of the prodigal sons.

item.title: Jesus on Inclusivity
item.itunes:title: Jesus on Inclusivity
item.description: Secular inclusivity pretends to accept and celebrate all lifestyles, but is actually rather exclusive to people who don't align with their agenda. Biblical inclusivity acknowledges the demands of following Jesus, yet genuinely invites all to trust him and join the community of the church. Pastor Jeremy resumes our Good News for All series with a sermon on inclusivity from Luke 14:12-24.
item.content:encoded: Secular inclusivity pretends to accept and celebrate all lifestyles, but is actually rather exclusive to people who don't align with their agenda. Biblical inclusivity acknowledges the demands of following Jesus, yet genuinely invites all to trust him and join the community of the church. Pastor Jeremy resumes our Good News for All series with a sermon on inclusivity from Luke 14:12-24.

item.title: A Song of Repentance for the Sinful Soul
item.itunes:title: A Song of Repentance for the Sinful Soul
item.description: A contrite heart is not just satisfied with forgiveness, but longs for the joy of a restored fellowship with God. Guest preacher Afshin Ziafat continues our summer series through the Psalms with a sermon from Psalm 51.
item.content:encoded: A contrite heart is not just satisfied with forgiveness, but longs for the joy of a restored fellowship with God. Guest preacher Afshin Ziafat continues our summer series through the Psalms with a sermon from Psalm 51.

item.title: How A Righteous Lord Helps Us Face Suffering and Oppression
item.itunes:title: How A Righteous Lord Helps Us Face Suffering and Oppression
item.description: The gospel means we can be afflicted but still prevail, be afflicted but still joyful and hopeful, and be afflicted yet at peace. Guest preacher Vermon Pierre continues our series through the Psalms with a sermon exploring Psalm 129.
item.content:encoded: The gospel means we can be afflicted but still prevail, be afflicted but still joyful and hopeful, and be afflicted yet at peace. Guest preacher Vermon Pierre continues our series through the Psalms with a sermon exploring Psalm 129.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: An Antidote for Spiritual Amnesia
item.itunes:title: An Antidote for Spiritual Amnesia
item.description: The gospel truths found in Psalm 103 invite us to bask in the glory and the goodness of our God, provide an antidote to our spiritual amnesia, and can soften our calloused hearts. Pastor Goodwin Deng continues our summer Psalm series with his first sermon for our church family.
item.content:encoded: The gospel truths found in Psalm 103 invite us to bask in the glory and the goodness of our God, provide an antidote to our spiritual amnesia, and can soften our calloused hearts. Pastor Goodwin Deng continues our summer Psalm series with his first sermon for our church family.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Lord Is On Your Side
item.itunes:title: The Lord Is On Your Side
item.description: The God on your side will stop at nothing to defend, protect, establish, and save. Pastor Kevin Weiner continues our summer series through Psalms with a sermon from Psalm 124.
item.content:encoded: The God on your side will stop at nothing to defend, protect, establish, and save. Pastor Kevin Weiner continues our summer series through Psalms with a sermon from Psalm 124.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Deeper the Wells the Brighter Thy Stars
item.itunes:title: The Deeper the Wells the Brighter Thy Stars
item.description: God is a God of rescue. Guest preacher Christian Simas from Reality Stockton launches our summer Psalms series with a sermon from Psalm 40.
item.content:encoded: God is a God of rescue. Guest preacher Christian Simas from Reality Stockton launches our summer Psalms series with a sermon from Psalm 40.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Seek the Kingdom
item.itunes:title: Seek the Kingdom
item.description: We don't need to live in anxiety that comes from focusing on the wrong things. Let's focus on Christ—and seeking his kingdom—and experience peace. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News For All series with a sermon from Luke 12:22-31.
item.content:encoded: We don't need to live in anxiety that comes from focusing on the wrong things. Let's focus on Christ—and seeking his kingdom—and experience peace. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News For All series with a sermon from Luke 12:22-31.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Guarding Against Covetousness
item.itunes:title: Guarding Against Covetousness
item.description: How do we guard against covetousness? Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 12:13-21 comparing the covetous heart to the generous heart and learning what it means to be rich toward God.
item.content:encoded: How do we guard against covetousness? Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 12:13-21 comparing the covetous heart to the generous heart and learning what it means to be rich toward God.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Perseverance in Prayer
item.itunes:title: Perseverance in Prayer
item.description: How do we pray? Why do we pray? Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 11:1-13 looking at the "Lord's Prayer."
item.content:encoded: How do we pray? Why do we pray? Pastor Nathan Potter continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 11:1-13 looking at the "Lord's Prayer."
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Martha & Mary
item.itunes:title: Martha & Mary
item.description: The pace of our exterior lives is merely a reflection of our hurried souls…but Jesus offers a different way of life! Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 10:38-42.
item.content:encoded: The pace of our exterior lives is merely a reflection of our hurried souls…but Jesus offers a different way of life! Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 10:38-42.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Good Samaritan
item.itunes:title: The Good Samaritan
item.description: The parable of the good Samaritan is one of the most famous stories in the world, but also perhaps one of the most misunderstood. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 10:25-37.
item.content:encoded: The parable of the good Samaritan is one of the most famous stories in the world, but also perhaps one of the most misunderstood. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Good News for All series with a sermon from Luke 10:25-37.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: The Church as Family
item.itunes:title: The Church as Family
item.description: Scripture depicts the church as a family whose table is open to anyone; who are sons, daughters, brothers, sisters, and spiritual fathers and mothers to one another, and whose household code is the Word of God. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 8:19-21.
item.content:encoded: Scripture depicts the church as a family whose table is open to anyone; who are sons, daughters, brothers, sisters, and spiritual fathers and mothers to one another, and whose household code is the Word of God. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 8:19-21.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Partnership from the Heart
item.itunes:title: Partnership from the Heart
item.description: Have ears to hear. Listen and live by God's word. We must let it all the way in to our hearts. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Luke with a sermon from 8:1-15 on the parable of the soils.
item.content:encoded: Have ears to hear. Listen and live by God's word. We must let it all the way in to our hearts. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Luke with a sermon from 8:1-15 on the parable of the soils.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Love Your Enemy
item.itunes:title: Love Your Enemy
item.description: What does Jesus mean by "enemy," what does the command to love our enemies not mean, what does it look like to follow it, and what will motivate us to persist in it? Pastor Philip Chew continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 6:27-36.
item.content:encoded: What does Jesus mean by "enemy," what does the command to love our enemies not mean, what does it look like to follow it, and what will motivate us to persist in it? Pastor Philip Chew continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 6:27-36.

item.title: Jesus, Our Healer
item.itunes:title: Jesus, Our Healer
item.description: Luke parallels physical sickness and sin because the call to repentance is a call to healing if we will receive it and follow him. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 5:12-32.
item.content:encoded: Luke parallels physical sickness and sin because the call to repentance is a call to healing if we will receive it and follow him. Pastor Nathan Potter continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 5:12-32.

item.title: The Mission of Jesus
item.itunes:title: The Mission of Jesus
item.description: Who is Jesus? What is his mission? What does it mean for us? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 4:16-30.
item.content:encoded: Who is Jesus? What is his mission? What does it mean for us? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 4:16-30.

item.title: Temptation
item.itunes:title: Temptation
item.description: What do we do when we experience real temptation? And what if it can be an opportunity to actually grow as followers of Jesus? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 4:1-13.
item.content:encoded: What do we do when we experience real temptation? And what if it can be an opportunity to actually grow as followers of Jesus? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our series through Luke with a sermon from Luke 4:1-13.

item.title: Good News for All
item.itunes:title: Good News for All
item.description: While all of Scripture is ultimately the story of Jesus, the most direct and thorough narrative of his life is found in the gospel of Luke. Pastor Jeremy Treat launches our new series through the book of Luke with a sermon from Luke 1:1-4.
item.content:encoded: While all of Scripture is ultimately the story of Jesus, the most direct and thorough narrative of his life is found in the gospel of Luke. Pastor Jeremy Treat launches our new series through the book of Luke with a sermon from Luke 1:1-4.

item.title: Politics
item.itunes:title: Politics
item.description: "Jesus Is Lord" is a political statement. How do we follow him faithfully in our current political environment? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Isaiah 11:1-9.
item.content:encoded: "Jesus Is Lord" is a political statement. How do we follow him faithfully in our current political environment? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Isaiah 11:1-9.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Body
item.itunes:title: Body
item.description: What does it mean to follow God with our physical being? Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Genesis 2:5-7 about our bodies.
item.content:encoded: What does it mean to follow God with our physical being? Pastor Jonathan Fitzgerald continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Genesis 2:5-7 about our bodies.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Art
item.itunes:title: Art
item.description: How do we become a community that appreciates art, reflects God's creativity, and pursues beauty? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Exodus 31:1-5.
item.content:encoded: How do we become a community that appreciates art, reflects God's creativity, and pursues beauty? Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Exodus 31:1-5.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Science
item.itunes:title: Science
item.description: Science is in no way incompatible with Christianity. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Psalm 104.
item.content:encoded: Science is in no way incompatible with Christianity. Pastor Jeremy Treat continues our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Psalm 104.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Mental Health
item.itunes:title: Mental Health
item.description: The gospel doesn't mean our mental health challenges simply go away, but it does mean we need to learn to see them (like all of life!) through the lens of discipleship. Pastor Jeremy Treat resumes our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Psalm 42.
item.content:encoded: The gospel doesn't mean our mental health challenges simply go away, but it does mean we need to learn to see them (like all of life!) through the lens of discipleship. Pastor Jeremy Treat resumes our Everyday Discipleship series with a sermon from Psalm 42.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles

item.title: Jesus Gave All
item.itunes:title: Jesus Gave All
item.description: Jesus gave all for you. You can trust him with all of you. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches an Easter sermon from Romans 8:31-34.
item.content:encoded: Jesus gave all for you. You can trust him with all of you. Pastor Jeremy Treat preaches an Easter sermon from Romans 8:31-34.
item.itunes:author: Reality Church of Los Angeles
